author: Michael Larabel
description: A new set of Linux kernel patches posted today work to improve the nested VMX performance for benefiting Intel processors making use of KVM virtualization...
title: New Linux Patches Enhance Intel Nested Virtualization Performance On Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: Microsoft is preparing to ship Windows 11 25H2 as their newest incremental update to their operating system. Windows 11 25H2 is currently available via their preview channel in advance of the formal public release in October. With Canonical also putting the finishing touches on their Ubuntu 25.10 release also due for a stable release in October, here are some benchmarks looking at how those competing operating systems are fairing in various CPU benchmarks on the same hardware.
title: First Benchmarks Of Windows 11 25H2 vs. Ubuntu 25.10 On AMD Ryzen 9 9950X

author: Michael Larabel
description: The XFS file-system is ready to declare their online file-system checking "fsck" support in good enough shape for enabling by default in new kernel builds. Plus other XFS alterations ahead of Linux 6.18 that is expected to be this year's LTS kernel version...
title: XFS File-System Ready To Enable Online Fsck Support By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch series that has been in development for a while now introduces the concept of "sheaves" for an opt-in, per-CPU and array-based caching layer for the SLUB kernel allocator. It looks like the sheaves patches are likely to be introduced for the Linux 6.18 kernel if no objections are raised...
title: Linux Looks Ready To Introduce "Sheaves" For Opt-In Per-CPU Array-Based Caching Layer

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new AMD driver set to be introduced in the upcoming Linux 6.18 kernel cycle barring any last minute problems is a TRNG driver for Versal SoCs...
title: AMD-Xilinx Versal TRNG Driver Queued Ahead Of Linux 6.18
